10.title: Christopher Lloyd & Lisa Loiacono
10.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Arthur von Wiesenberger
1.plot: Special guest, local food personality Arthur von Wiesenberger, joins Chef Budi Kazali to explore some exotic food combinations. Together, they prepare an out-or-this world cauliflower soup with a mushroom ragout and lamb shank with couscous risotto style.

2.title: Jim Messina
2.plot: Who knew that musician Jim Messina was such a food buff? The former Loggins and Messina star shares his peppercorn salmon recipe with Chef Budi Kazali. Chef Kazali answers with gnocchi to accompany the salmon.

3.title: Andrew Firestone
3.plot: Chef Budi Kazali visits the Firestone Walker Brewery, where he is joined by Andrew Firestone. Together they show off recipes featuring Firestone beers, including calamari, shepherd's pie and a unique French onion soup.

4.title: Bill Foley
4.plot: Bill Foley, a highly regarded vintner, the proprietor of multiple wineries, including Firestone and Lincourt, shares his extensive wine knowledge with Chef Budi Kazali. Together they combine the right wines with a menu of Wedge salad & Steak au Poive.

5.title: Sheriff Bill Brown
5.plot: With 35 years experience, Santa Barbara County Sheriff Brown is an expert in law enforcement. But his cooking skills are a bit rusty. Chef Kazali will help him polish those skills today, with crab summer rolls and seafood Thai curry.

6.title: Debby Davison & Anne Towbes
6.plot: Debby is an avid cook, while Anne is looking to improve her skills. Chef Kazali offers up a Bibb lettuce salad with warm shrimp vinaigrette, and halibut with roasted cauliflower and capers, while Debbie shares her delicious rum cake recipe.

1.title: Krista Harris
1.plot: Today Edible Santa Barbara Editor and Publisher Krista Harris joins host Craig Case and Chef Michael Hutchings in the kitchen at the beautiful Crossroads Estate. With Curried Local Mussels, Watkins Ranch Beef and Chef John Bertrno's Chocolate Mousse on the menu, this is sure to be an episode to remember.

2.title: Archie McLaren
2.plot: Archie McLaren is the Founder and Chairmen of The Central Coast Wine Classic and has hosted a gala culinary event at Hearst Castle for the past 25 years. He joins his good friend Chef Michael Hutchings and Host Craig Case for a delightful episode of The Inn Crowd, including some excellent wine pairings from The Foley Food and Wine Society. Also appearing in this episode is Doug Bush of The Cultured Abalone Farm. Cheers!

3.title: Lady Leslie Ridley-Tree
3.plot: This week The Inn Crowd is honored to welcome philanthropist and community leader Lady Leslie Ridley-Tree to The Crossroads Kitchen. Chef Michael Hutchings has selected a menu inspired by the British Isles including the salad served during the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II in 1953 (and again during her Diamond Jubilee in 2013). Host Craig Case also joins Chef Michael and Lady Leslie for some delicious Traditional English Bread Pudding in the Crossroads Dining Room.

12.title: Milt & Arlene Larsen
12.plot: This week's episode of The Inn Crowd is truly magical. We're on location at the home of Magic Castle Founder Milt Larsen. Host Craig Case and Chef Michael Hutchings are joined by Milt and his lovely wife Arlene as they prepare a traditional holiday dinner with some of Chef Michael's special cooking tips.
